subject: Leadership
title: What Is Strategic Thinking?
description: A quick, practical guide to What Is Strategic Thinking?.

hook.text: A CEO works 80-hour weeks solving daily fires. Revenue still drops. She's busy, but she's not strategic.

buildup.text: Strategic thinking is the ability to see the big picture, anticipate change, and make choices that shape the future.

discovery.text: It's not about being smarterâ€”it's about thinking at a different altitude. Tactics win battles; strategy wins wars.

twist.text: Most leaders spend 90% of time on operations and 10% on strategy. The most effective ones flip that ratio.

climax.text: Strategic thinking can be learned. It starts with carving out time to reflect, question assumptions, and plan ahead.

punchline.text: Busy isn't strategic. Choosing what not to do is.

quiz.question: What distinguishes strategic thinking from operational work?
options: Seeing the big picture and shaping the future
